text: "Careful listening," Alvin Lucier once wrote, "is more important than making sounds happen." Rest easy, dear friend. Over the years he sent Andrew boxes of his old periodicals. author_desc: Computer music, and talking too much in equal measure.
text:
At Edinburgh uni, where I did my masters, there was an edit suite with 8 loudspeakers arranged along the length of the room, and a mixing desk. And I set up a mic and performed with the sound of the room and the distances to the speakers resonating.

Because of Alvin Lucier.

text: Alvin Lucier (1931-2021) tiene una pieza donde se graba a sí mismo recitando un texto en una habitación, luego reproduce lo que grabó y lo vuelve a grabar, para volver a reproducir el resultado, grabarlo y así sucesivamente. Lo que sucede es increíble. https://t.co/7I8pQAj729

RIP Alvin Lucier, one of the most beautiful composers of them all. His work changed the way I listen and the way i move through space. Today I'm thinking about the joy of hearing his whispered remembrances directly between my ears from during a performance of Heavier Than Air

author_desc: Kitschy cat. I sell books and sometimes read them.
text: RIP Alvin Lucier. Sarah Hennies elucidates better than I ever could, but I often think about just how moving I am Sitting in a Room is. I also remember picking up Crossings in my early 20s and having no clue what to make of it. It was a wonderful feeling. https://t.co/8pkJP8y1pz
referenced_tweets: [{'type': 'quoted', 'id': '1393386783816273921', 'text': 'That said, Lucier\'s music is often thought of as scientific, about perception & how sound behaves, but "I am sitting in a room" is deeply tied to his humanity, a way of processing a difficult thing he lives with (a stutter). author_desc:
クラシック音楽ファン。現代、近代フランス、後期ロマン派、後期バロックなどがとくに好き。指揮、編曲、ピアノ演奏、マンドリン演奏などを行っています。譜面部屋とCD部屋が１部屋ずつ。生活空間が……。 
Tシャツ収集癖あり。
近現代中心に美術全般も好き。そのほか、光るもの、半透明なもの、ゆるいもの、おまぬけなものに魅かれる。
text:
Alvin Lucier - CRISS-CROSS (2013) for Two Electric Guitars

山田岳・土橋庸人 - Electric Guitar
東京アートミュージアム（仙川）での名演。

この日は観客が自由に歩いて音を聴く趣向。同じ音響が鳴っているのに、自分の耳の向きをわずかに変えただけで唸り具合が変化。

text:
RIP Alvin Lucier…
I met him a few years ago at the Robert Ashley Symposium at Wesleyan. This badass sat right up front, with his cane & sporting a Black Lives Matter hoodie. He is considered a master in the experimental music field and will forever be remembered as a champion.

Sad to hear that Alvin Lucier passed away, but what a legacy. If you're anything like me, Lucier was a portal tomb to the broader world of sound art, a bridging point for someone like me between Morton Feldman and early electroacoustic performers.

text: It is a cliche to name a "genius" who "changed" music, listening or recording for everyone who followed. Often it is a bullshit honorific. I am however sincere when I say Alvin Lucier, genius, invented new ways to hear, execute, record and think about music and sound. Requiescat.

author_desc: A collection of curated audio streams, unique programs and features to promote calm and focus through classical music.
text:
The groundbreaking American composer and educator Alvin Lucier died Wednesday at his home in Middletown, Conn. Through monumental works like ‘I Am Sitting in a Room’ and ‘Music on a Long Thin Wire,' Lucier was able to change the way we think about sound. 
https://t.co/zsVwakbmJc https://t.co/dw9RMoIcVo

text:
#2021年ベストアルバム
② Alvin Lucier『Music for Piano XL』
残念ながら、先日90歳で亡くなったアメリカの現代音楽作曲家Lucierの最晩年の作品。「間」に満ちた静謐なピアノと、オシレーターによるサイン波の組み合わせは、坂本龍一とAlva Notoのコラボも彷彿とさせます。
https://t.co/NWFnAI59Mk https://t.co/zQLODVrGls

text: Alvin Lucier showed us a new way to listen and to appreciate sound in every room. Thank you, Alvin. ❤️ https://t.co/vz9rrhRJJW

text: @Mark_Stryker I've just run into this situation twice in the past 24 hours, including while @nightafternight & I were preparing a very brief tribute to Alvin Lucier. I'm certainly not going to look for a way to trim 3 seconds from his performance of "I am sitting in a room" 2/

author_desc: Composer/Performer based in Springdale, Arkansas. Debut album “cable theory vol. 1” out now. On a bit of a Twitter break. Reach me through the link below.
text:
I woke up today thinking about Alvin Lucier.

I’m not sure if it’s the sort of thing he would have liked, but I started my day with a 10 minutes performance for myself using just a delay pedal, trying to explore resonance and texture.

Yesterday we lost Alvin Lucier, understood by many as the most cerebral of the so-called minimal composers. 
I met Alvin back in Ostrava in the 00s. I thought at the time that this was an interesting mind, but I didn’t really get it. 1/6
